intro: Eriogonum zionis, commonly known as the Zion's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in the Zion National Park area. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its basal leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum zionis plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
